subject: College Athletics
Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Jason Lawrence scored a power-play goal with 14.4 seconds left, and Boston University advanced to the Frozen Four for the first time in 12 years, beating New Hampshire, 2-1, in the N.C.A.A. Northeast Regional final in Manchester, N.H. The Terriers (33-6-4), the only top-seeded team remaining in the tournament, will face Vermont in the semifinals on April 9 in Washington. Bemidji State, which beat Cornell, 4-1, on Sunday, will face Miami of Ohio in the other semifinal.
